page.title: 02BIOGRAPHY
page.content: {Joseph Whitaker,born in 1850}lived at Rainworth Lodge,a beautifully situated house with historic connections. Throughout his life he was devoted to the study of birds & ,he was to make Rainworth a sanctuary for them. The house nestles in a small wooded valley with Rainworth Water running down from Fountaindale, having been widened into a small lake to attract the water fowl.Behind the house Whitaker created his bird walk-an acre of woodland,beyond which he made a deer park with Japanese deer. Rainworth Lodge housed Whitaker's famous bird collection;mostly British & containing many rarities,especially albinoes.He contributed to the Victoria County History.He belonged to the Royal Zoological Society.The local Comprehensive school perpetuates his name.
